definition: to brand/to iron/to bake (in a pan)
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
to brand (cattle etc)/brand/(fig.) to leave a lasting mark/to stigmatize/mark/stamp/stigma
the hot pillar (ancient Chinese torture instrument)

sentences.english: The cows were branded with an A in a circle.
sentences.chinese: 那些牛被烙上了加圓圈的A字。

sentences.english: Farmer Brown's cattle are branded with the letter B.
sentences.chinese: 農場主布朗的牛都烙上了字母“B”的印記。

sentences.english: Thick glass supported by solid chrome rings.
sentences.chinese: 厚玻璃由堅固的烙環作撐腳。

sentences.english: Turn the cake over and bake it some more.
sentences.chinese: 把餅翻個兒再烙一會兒。

sentences.english: All the happiness and sadness, it already marked so deep in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 全部的幸福和悲悼，都早已深烙我心。

sentences.english: Do not give children the history of the growth of branded deep a scar?
sentences.chinese: 難道不會給孩子的成長史中深深的烙上一道疤痕？

sentences.english: The metal stag is emblazed on every bottle to represent the clan MacKenzie.
sentences.chinese: 每瓶都烙上了代表麥肯齊氏的金屬標誌。

sentences.english: Flipping burgers is not beneath your dignity.
sentences.chinese: 烙牛肉餅並不有損你的尊嚴。

sentences.english: She burned the image of a tiger into the wood panel.
sentences.chinese: 她在木嵌板上烙出了虎的形象。

sentences.english: Green onion pancake that a large dry branded beauty that you can let cool and eat.
sentences.chinese: 這種幹烙蔥油餅有一大妙處，那就是可以放涼了喫。

sentences.english: Others would have red-hot irons and pincers applied to their flesh.
sentences.chinese: 其他一些人則遭到熱得通紅的烙鐵和鉗子烙燙皮肉。

sentences.english: Rule No.5: Flipping burgers is not beneath your dignity.
sentences.chinese: 烙牛肉餅並不會有失你的體面。

sentences.english: Salo is a Ukrainian tradition that dates back centuries.
sentences.chinese: “薩烙”是烏克蘭的傳統，有幾百年了。

definition: blank (e.g. for a coin)/unburnt earthenware/semifinished product/Taiwan pr. [pei1]
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
to evaporate/(of cooking) to steam/torch made from hemp stalks or bamboo (old)/finely chopped firewood (old)
